question: What is Monsoon Fire Pottery?
answer: Monsoon Fire is a production-first ceramics studio in the West Valley. We work out of a 2,500 sqft basement studio plus 1,000 sqft of garage and outdoor workspace, built for steady firing, quiet making, and dependable support.

question: Who is the studio for?
answer: We are most useful for production potters and serious hobbyists who need dependable firing and workspace. If you are brand-new to clay and want structured group workshops, we can point you to great Phoenix studios. If you want focused, independent time, you will feel at home here.

question: How is Potter of the Month selected?
answer: Potter of the Month features are selected from active studio members. We look at the work moving through the kilns and rotate highlights through the membership. It is a member-only feature rather than an open nomination.

question: How do I get the address and gate code?
answer: We share the exact address and access details through the portal once your account is set up. Create a free portal account here.

question: How do I submit a firing request?
answer: Submit a firing request through the portal with your clay body, glaze notes, and firing type. You will see the current scheduling window there too.

question: What are the kiln firing prices?
answer:
Half shelf = about a carry-on suitcase laid flat. Tall pieces need clearance; handles waste space; stacks are more efficient. If you are unsure, send a quick photo and we will help estimate. We bill by per-shelf or whole-kiln only; we do not bill by kiln volume.

  • Full Kiln (or custom fire) — $60
  • Half-Shelf Bisque — $15
  • Half-Shelf Glaze — $25
  • Community Shelf — $0 (lowest priority, space permitting, with shelf-owner permission, and excluded from firing triggers)
  • Delivery — $25 per trip

question: How do I estimate how many half shelves I need?
answer: If your work fits laid flat inside a carry-on, that is about one half shelf. Tall pieces need clearance; handles and irregular shapes take extra room; stacks (like plates) are more efficient. When in doubt, ask and we will help size it.

question: How often do you fire?
answer: We fire at least once per week and add extra loads when demand is high. Most weeks include both bisque and mid-fire glaze firings.

question: What kiln do you use?
answer: We fire in an L&L eQ2827-3 electric oxidation kiln with a Genesis touch screen controller, rated to cone 10. A raku reduction kiln is planned for the property.

question: Do you load the kiln for me?
answer: Yes. Kilns are loaded by studio technicians so spacing, supports, and kiln furniture are handled safely and consistently.

question: What is a day pass?
answer: Day passes are $40 and include access to studio equipment and work areas by reservation. Book through the portal so we can keep the floor calm and workable.

question: How do memberships work?
answer: Membership tiers include A la Carte, Apprentice, Journeyman, and Master, with varying firing credits, storage, and discounts. Compare tiers on the Memberships page; pricing is published in the portal. We are happy to help you choose.

question: How do payments work?
answer: We process online payments through Stripe. If you need to pay in person, we have a POS for tap card payments. If you need another arrangement, just reach out.

question: How often are workshops offered?
answer: Workshops are occasional and announced when the studio schedule allows. Invites go to members and details are posted in the portal.

question: Can you pick up supplies for me?
answer: Yes. Members can request supplies through the portal and pick them up during a reservation, or ask for delivery.

question: Do you offer reduction firing?
answer: Not yet. A raku reduction kiln is planned for the property, and we will announce it through the portal when it is ready.
